required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Food on Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Asasantin ER in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Food on Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Asasantin Extended Release (ER) 200/25 mg Capsules b.i.d. in a Randomized, Open, 2-way Cross-over Study in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: Comparative pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of Asasantin ER at fasted and fed state

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration-time curve of dipyridamole in plasma at steady state (AUCss)
Maximum concentration of dipyridamole in plasma at steady state (Cmax,ss)
Change in Inhibition of cyclooxygenase for acetylsalicylic acid (ASA), analyte thromboxane B2 (TXB2)
Maximum concentration of dipyridamole in plasma from 0 to 10h (Cmax,0-10h)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of peak concentration of the analytes in plasma over area under the curve at steady state (Cmax,ss / AUC,ss)
Area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma from 0 to 10 h (AUC0-10h)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 10 hours after start of drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent peak trough fluctuation of dipyridamole in plasma (%PTF)
Time to reach the maximum concentration of the analytes in plasma at steady state (Tmax,ss)
Terminal half-life of the analytes in plasma (t1/2)
Percent area under the curve fluctuation of dipyridamole in plasma (AUCfluct)
Area under the concentration-time curve of ASA in plasma at steady state (AUCss)
Maximum concentration of ASA in plasma at steady state (Cmax,ss)
Change in Inhibition of cyclooxygenase for acetylsalicylic acid (ASA), analyte malondialdehyde
Number of subjects with clinically significant changes in vital signs (blood pressure, pulse rate)
Number of subjects with abnormal changes in laboratory parameters
Number of subjects with adverse events

arm_group.arm_group_label: Asasantin ER after a standardized breakfast

intervention.arm_group_label: Asasantin ER after a standardized breakfast
Asasantin ER after a standardized breakfast

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects as determined by results of screening
- Signed written informed consent in accordance with good clinical practice (GCP) and local legislation
- Age ≥ 18 and ≤ 55 years
- Broca ≥ - 20 % and ≤ + 20 %
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any findings of the medical examination (including blood pressure, pulse rate and ECG) deviating from normal and of clinical relevance
- Gastrointestinal, hepatic, renal, respiratory, cardiovascular, metabolic, immunological or hormonal disorders
- Surgery of the gastro-intestinal tract (except appendectomy)
- Diseases of the central nervous system (such as epilepsy) or psychiatric disorders
- Chronic or relevant acute infections
- History of hypersensitivity to Asasantin ER and any of the excipients
- Intake of drugs with a long half-life (> 24 hours) (< 1 month prior to administration or during the trial)
- Use of any drugs which might influence the results of the trial (≤ 10 days prior to administration or during the trial)
- Participation in another trial with an investigational drug (< 1 month prior to administration or during the trial)
- Known alcohol abuse
- Known drug abuse
- Blood donation (< 1 month prior to administration)
- Excessive physical activities (< 5 days prior to administration)
- History of hemorrhagic diatheses
- History of gastro-intestinal ulcer, perforating or bleeding
- History of bronchial asthma
- Any laboratory value outside the normal range of clinical relevance
Female subjects:
- Pregnancy
- Positive pregnancy test
- No adequate contraception (adequate contraception e.g. sterilization, intrauterine devices (IUD), oral contraceptives)
- Inability to maintain this adequate contraception during the whole study period
- Lactation period
